title: CMS and eCommerce sites
description:
Whether teaming up for a new build with a partner company, or jumping in on an existing site to iterate and improve, wearing the front-end hat is a joy. The focus on execution and efficiency is a refreshing contrast to the broader design thinking involved in UX and design tasks. Also, I beleive my perspective on design and UX is enriched by participating so heavily in development.

In each of these examples, development was my primary task, but I also either collobarated directly with the designers on the team or I identified and fulfilled UX and design needs when called for.

mainSlider.title: UVA Licensing and Ventures Group
mainSlider.caption: Revisions to site architecture and design overhaul of key sections. Built on Craft CMS

mainSlider.title: Corgibytes | Marketing Website
mainSlider.caption: Light UX audit to site. Design and feature additions to blog section. Built with jekyll.

mainSlider.title: Baby Change-N-Go | Shopify theme
mainSlider.caption: Design consulting, then build from provided design. Extensive theme extension in Shopify.

mainSlider.title: PDI Healthcare and We Are PDI sites
mainSlider.caption: For RTS Labs. Front-end developer for build of pdihc.com and wearepdi.com on WordPress.
